passages.text: ASIA- PACIFIC excl. Japan | Autos & Auto Parts Zhongsheng

Zhongsheng reported 1H25 results with revenue of RMB77.3bn, down \(6\%\) YoY, and earnings of RMB1.0bn, down \(36\%\) YoY, due to widened losses from new car sales and slowed down growth of after- sales service. We attended the analyst briefing following the results on Aug 28. Key messages include: 1) mgmt sees new car sales is about to bottom out; 2) mgmt expects their full- year AITO sales to remain \(5\% - 8\%\) of total AITO sales volume in China. Maintain Buy.
1H25 results missed on widened losses from new car sales and slowed down growth of after- sales service.

- New car sales. Volumes declined by \(2\%\) YoY to 229k units, of which AITO contributed 11k units, accounting for \(5\%\) of total sales. However, given the ongoing intense competition in China, new car sales margin further dropped to \(-4.1\%\) in 1H25 from \(-3.3\%\) in 1H24. 
- Aftersales service. Revenue saw flattish growth to RMB13.4bn in 1H. The lower-than-expected growth was partially due to the loss of after-sales volume caused by store closures. GPM came in at \(47.4\%\) . 
- Used-car. Transactions recorded 111k units, up \(10\%\) YoY, but the gross profit saw \(58\%\) YoY decrease to RMB257mn, because the trade-in subsidies resulted in a higher proportion of older vehicles which had lower asp/profit per car.

Zhongsheng sees light at the end of the tunnel for new car sales. Mgmt noted that in the past 18 months, although OEMs have gradually increased subsidies to dealers, with subsidies per vehicle rising by RMB19k, \((\sim 7\%\) margin), the company's new car sales margin declined from \(0.8\%\) in 2023 to \(- 4.1\%\) in 1H25 given the average transaction price per car has dropped by RMB33k. However, the company sees an inflection point for new car sales profitability, supported by: 1) accelerating consolidation of dealership networks given of unprecedented high volume of leads of potential store transfers across brands; 2) upcoming competitive new product offerings based on new platform design featured enhanced smart features; 3) effect from "anti- involution" campaign. Mgmt saw discounts rates for luxury cars narrowed by \(3.1\%\) July- 25 compared with 1H25.

AITO stores on track. of Aug- 25, Zhongsheng indicated it has opened 38 AITO stores and 1 HIMA store. Mgmt continues to emphasize local market concentration strategy, and suggested that in H25 their AITO stores accounted for \(8\% /18\%\) of AITO's total sales volume in China/core cities. Meanwhile, the company expects its full- year sales contribution to remain \(5\% - 8\%\) of total AITO sales volume given the product mix change in 2H25. On the other hand, mgmt positioned that AITO brands delivered a positive \(0.6\%\) marginal contribution to the company's new car sales margin in 1H25. Based on our estimates, the gross profit per AITO car in 1H25 reached c.RMB14k (new car sales margin of c. \(3.9\%\) ) at Zhongsheng's stores.
JEF view. We lowered our earnings estimates by for 2025/2026E to factor in weaker-than- expected margin and AM business growth. Our PT was lowered to HK\$20.5 based on 12x 2026E. Maintain Buy.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 4-9 of this report. \\*Jefferies Hong Kong Limited
TARGETIESTIMATE CHANGE

Exhibit 1 - Dealers' New Car Sales Gross Margin
Source: Company, Jefferies
Exhibit 2 - Zhongsheng saw - RMB19k increase in OEM subsidies per vehicle over L18M
Source: Company, Jefferies
The company will maintain solid growth of aftersales services and used- car business.- Margin pressure persists, given intensifying price competition in both ICE and EV markets.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
New car sales continued loss making. Maintain consistent growth of aftersales business with stable margin. Price target of HK\$20.5 based on 12x FY26E PE.
Better- than- expected margin recovery. Sales of luxury brands pick up. Price target of HK\$25.6 based on 15x 2026E PE.
Weaker- than- expected margin Slower- than- expectation repair centers expansion. Price target of HK\$10.2 based on 6x 2026E PE.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Customer service: High- quality after- sales service is an important indicator for customers to choose 4S dealerships. Besides that, product quality management is also a major ESG concern for Zhongsheng. 2) Customer privacy: Zhongsheng has access to customers' information, including order history, personal information, and financial information, etc. Zhongsheng should comply with all the regulations regarding personal privacy and ensure security and compliance in data use.
Company Target(s): 1) Increasing employee awareness of energy saving and environmental protection. 2) Utilize cleaning resources.
Qs to Mgmt: 1) How do you evaluate the company performance of ESG? 2) How can used cars help realize carbon neutrality?
Retail discounts start to narrow New progress on AM market Updates on new strategy
Exhibit 3-Company Snapshot - Zhongsheng
Source: Company, Jefferies

Zhongsheng is a leading auto dealer in China, covering multiple luxury brands and mid- to- high end mass market brands, including Mercedes, BMW, Audi, Porsche, Lexus, and Toyota etc. The company is also involved in used car dealership, auto financing, and auto insurance business.
Our price target of HKD20.5 implies 12x 2026E P/E. Risks: lower- than- expected new store openings and weaker- than- expected auto demand.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Zhongsheng Group Holding (881 HK: HK\$15.10, BUY)

Notes: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
